titles.title: Säʿatat zä-mäʿalt wä-zä-lelit “Horologium for the Day and the Night Hours”/ Märḥa ʿǝwwuran “Guide of the Blind Ones”/ Tarik zä-Wäldä ʿAmid “The History of Wäldä ʿAmid”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Säʿatat zä-mäʿalt wä-zä-lelit “Horologium for the Day and the Night Hours” (fols. 5r-78v) II) Märḥa ʿǝwwuran “Guide of the Blind Ones” (for 199 years) (fols. 79r-121r) III) Tarik zä-Wäldä ʿAmid “The History of Wäldä ʿAmid” (called also Giyorgis Wäldä ʿAmid, in Ar. Ğirğis al-Makīn b. al-ʿAmid; from the creation of the world to Emperor Heraclius) (fols. 122r-218v)
Additiones 1-20.

donors.donor: Names of the commissioner (fols. 79r, 120rb) and his parents (fol. 120rb) have been erased.

dcomments.dcomment: The Ms. was possibly written around the year 1710 (s. Other details).

txstates.txstate: The majority of fols. are stained with water. The spine cover and the leather cover of the back board are missing. Fol. 3 is of smaller in width. A hole carefully amended on fol. 138.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather (partly missing). Parchment inlays or remains of parchment pastedowns on the inner side of both boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover, poorly visible (4 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, x-form, criss-cross).

bnothers.bnother: Quire XX is reinforced by a parchment guard.

txfolios.txfolio: There are mistakes in foliation: number 166 is missing, number 180 is followed by 191, 192, 193, ect.

squires.squire: A(4/fol. 1r-4v) – ፩(?)I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – ፪II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – ፫III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) – IX(9; s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 69r-77v) – ፲፪X(8/fols. 78r-85v) – ፪XI(8/fols. 86r-93v) – ፫(?)XII(8/fols. 94r-101v) – ፬XIII(8/fols. 102r-109v) – ፭XIV(8/fols. 110r-117v) – ፮XV(4/fols. 118r-121v) – XVI(7; s.l.: 5, stub after 2/fols. 122r-128v) – XVII(8/fols. 129r-136v) – XVIII(8/fols. 137r-144v) – XIX(2/fols. 145r-146v) – XX(8/fols. 147r-154v) – XXI(8/fols. 155r-162v) – XXII(8/fols. 163r-171v) – XXIII(8/fols. 172r-179v) – XXIV(8/fols. 180r-197v) – XXV(8/fols. 198r-205v) – XXVI(8/fols. 206r-213v) – XXVII(8/fols. 214r-221v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: Fine and careful; Hand b: Fine and careful.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 5r-120v, 147ra-218vb; broadly-spaced, upright letters Hand b: fols. 121r-146vb, 167ra; bigger, right-sloping, less-regular letters; after fol. 147 the script becomes somewhat smaller.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Märḥa ʿǝwwuran “Guide of the Blind Ones” is divided into two parts, each beginning with dates: 1) Fol. 79rab: 7569 ʿamätä śǝggawe “year of the Incarnation” (the year is wrongly describe as the “year of Incarnation”, perhaps the scribe meant the year 1569, i.e., 1576 A.D.), 1299 ʿamätä sämaʿǝtat “year of the martyrs” (= 1583 A.D). 2) Fol. 106vb: 7202 ʿamätä ʿaläm “year of the world” (= 1702 A.D.); 1702 ʿamätä śǝggawe (= 1709 A.D.); 1427 ʿamätä sämaʿǝtat (= 1711 A.D.). Most probably part 1) concerns the calculation of the past 136 years and, hence, some historical events are mentioned. Part 2) indicates the calculation of the 63 years following the production of the Ms. The dates approximately coincide with the fact that Fasilädäs began to reign 77 years earlier which is mentioned on fol. 92va. - Some sub-sections of Text II are completed by records of historical events from ca. 1570 to 1702, e.g., on fols. 80ra (on the death of Yǝsḥaq), 81ra, (on killing of "ʾAboli Galla"), 82ra (on campaign to Kwara (?), on the coming of Žan Meda), 83ra (on the death of Queen ʾAdmas Mogäsa), 83vb (on the enthronement of ḥaḍe Yaʿqob), 84vb (on the argument between ḥaḍe Yaʿqob and ras ʾAtnatewos), 85rb (on the death of ḥaḍe Zä-Dǝngǝl), 86ra (on the victory of ḥaḍe Śǝlṭan Säggäd over Wǝr(ǝ)nšo [Oromo]), 92va (on the death of Śǝlṭan Säggäd (Susǝnyos) and the enthronement of Fasilädäs). Some other historical records, in smaller script, by the same and different hand(s) are inserted beside and below the main text on fols. 79va, 82vb, 95va, 96rab.

additional.cont: Parchment pastedown on the inner side of the bront board: Unidentified prayer.
additional.det: The text is hardly legible because the ink has faded away.

additional.cont: Fol. 1ra: Protective prayer against snake bites.
additional.det: Crudely written, incomplete (?).

additional.cont: Fol. 1rb: Recipe for a medication.
additional.det: The name of the medication is erased; written by well-trained hand.

additional.cont: Fols. 1v-2r (in black ink, above), 2v-3ra (below): Hymn to St. George.
additional.det: Crudely written, in the same hand as Additiones 5-7, 12, 15. The same hymn is contained in SM-011 (fols. 163v-164r).

additional.cont: Fols. 1v-2r (in reddish brown ink), 3v-4r (above) and 4rb, 5r (above, in reddish-brown ink): Hymn(s) to the Virgin Mary.
additional.det: Crudely written, in the same hand as Additiones 4, 6, 7, 12, 15.

additional.cont: Fols. 3r-v, 4ra: List of the church feasts.
additional.det: Crudely written, by the same hand as additiones 4, 5, 7, 12, 15.

additional.cont: Fol. 4v: Excerpt from Mälkǝˀa Gäbrä Mänfäs Qəddus (“Image of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qəddus”).
additional.det: Crudely written in black and reddish-brown ink, in the same hand as Additiones 4-6, 12, 15.

additional.cont: Fols. 5v (in the lower margin): Excerpt from Mälkǝˀa ˀEdom (“Image of Paradise”).
additional.det: Written in a poor hand; some parts of the text are hardly legible because the ink has faded away.

additional.cont: Fols. 21va-30rb (in the lower margin): Unidentified hymn to the Virgin Mary.
additional.det: Some parts of the text are hardly legible because the ink has faded away; probably written in more than one hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 95vb: Note on the arrival of two unnamed metropolitans to Ethiopia.
additional.tran: Fol. 95vb: In this year came two metropolitans, one by Dänkale and one by Sənnar. The one who came by Sənnar was appointed.
additional.det: Carefully written in a good hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 120v-121ra: Register of lucky and unlucky days in each month of the year.
additional.det: Written in a mediocre hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 121ra-b, 121va: Protective prayers against abdominal pains, snake bites and the evil eye.
additional.det: Crudely written, in the same hand as Additiones 4-7, 15.

additional.cont: Fols. 219r-v: Unidentified text concerning the history of the Near and Middle East under the Turkish rule.
additional.det: Carefully written. The text may be a piece from the second part of the “History of Wäldä ʿAmid” concerning the history of Islam.

additional.cont: Fols. 218v (below), 219r (below): Magic recipe and a protective prayer.
additional.det: Crudely written in Gǝʿǝz and Amharic.

additional.cont: Fols. 219va-b (below), 220ra: Excerpt from Mälkəˀa Giyorgis (“Image of Giyorgis”).
additional.add: Fol. 219va: ኦ፡ ፍጡነ፡ ረድኤት፡ እምሩጸተ፡ ነፋስ፡ ወዓውሎ፡…
additional.det: Crudely written, in the same hand as Additiones 4-7, 12.

additional.cont: Fol. 220rb: Unidentified text about how Adam and Eve farmed the land.
additional.det: Written in a fine hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 220v (in the upper margin): Instruction on how to use the protective prayer.
additional.det: Written in a fine hand.

additional.cont: Fols. 220v (below addition 16): Protective prayer.
additional.det: Written in a fine hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 220vb, 221ra-221va: Prayer against ḥəmamä wəgˀat (rheumatism?).
additional.det: Written in a fine hand.

additional.cont: Fols. 221va: Three protective prayers.
additional.det: Crudely written in various hands.

extras.extra: - Fol. 1r: The titles “Säʿatat”, “Tarik zä-Wäldä ʿAmid” and the local shelf mark of the Ms. “420” are written in black big letters, in Tǝgrǝñña. - The closing part of Text I is written twice, in fols. 77 (by hand b) and 78 (by hand a). - Fol. 220v: Two hardly legible texts written in faded reddish-brown and black ink. - Initial letters of the sections of Text II, indicating the day on which the new year begins, are rewritten in smaller size to the left site. - Traces of an erased text in fol. 146vb (7 lines) and fol. 147ra (3 lines). - Fols. 1r, 3r, 4v, 7v, 94v, 221vb: Minor notes, writing exercises, crude drawings, doodles.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks (in the upper and occasionally in the lower left margin) on fols. 5r, 13r, 21r, 78r, 86r, 94r, 102r, 110r, 118r.
